content: The Act may be cited as the "Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004". The mission of the Department of Homeland Security is outlined in the Act. The "Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004" amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to ensure that civil rights and civil liberties are not compromised in efforts to secure the homeland. SEC. 3. OFFICER FOR CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure that individuals report directly to the Secretary and shall address concerns regarding profiling on the basis of race, ethnicity, or religion. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure direct reporting to the Secretary and address concerns of profiling based on race, ethnicity, or religion. Additionally, it includes provisions to assist in developing, implementing, and reviewing policies for civil rights and civil liberties protection within Department programs. Compliance with various legal requirements is also overseen.
